overview.description: Complete guide for capturing App Store screenshots
overview.required: At least 1 set for largest iPhone display size
overview.critical_rule: Screenshots MUST show app in use (NOT splash screen or login page only)

iphone_6_7_inch.priority: REQUIRED if app supports these devices
iphone_6_7_inch.note: This is typically the largest iPhone size required

iphone_6_5_inch.priority: REQUIRED if app supports these devices and not providing 6.7" screenshots

iphone_5_5_inch.note: May be required if targeting iOS versions that support these devices

ipad_pro_12_9_inch_3rd_gen.priority: REQUIRED if app is Universal (iPhone + iPad)

ipad_pro_11_inch.priority: OPTIONAL but recommended for iPad apps

screenshot_specifications.order: First 3 screenshots shown in search results → make them most compelling

must_show: App in active use (e.g., user interacting with elements)
must_not_show: ONLY splash screen or login page
ONLY app icon or title art
Violent or mature content (if app rated 4+, ALL screenshots must be 4+ safe)
Misleading content (screenshots must match actual app)
best_practices: First 3 screenshots: most important features (shown in search)
Each screenshot: focus on ONE key feature or benefit
Consider adding text overlays to explain features (optional)
Show app in context (e.g., someone using it)
Include Dark Mode screenshots if supported
Test on actual device to verify appearance

guidelines: Use large font sizes (minimum 18pt at actual size)
High contrast (white text on dark background or vice versa)
Localize text overlays for each language

step_1_prepare_app.task: Set up app with realistic content
actions: Use realistic user names (e.g., 'Sarah Johnson' not 'Test User')
Populate with real-looking content (articles, photos, data)
Set appropriate app state for each screenshot (onboarding, main screen, feature demo)
Ensure UI is polished (no bugs, placeholder text, broken images)

step_2_launch_simulators.task: Open required device simulators in Xcode
simulators: iPhone 16 Pro Max (6.7" - most common requirement)

step_3_capture_screenshots.task: Navigate app and capture key screens

xcode_debug_menu.menu: Debug → View Debugging → Capture View Hierarchy

xcode_organizer.menu: Window → Devices and Simulators → [Device] → Take Screenshot

automated_fastlane.use_case: Automate screenshot capture with UI tests
automated_fastlane.setup: gem install fastlane, fastlane snapshot init

screens_to_capture: Results or output screen (e.g., completed task)

step_4_organize_files.naming_convention: Use descriptive names with numbers for ordering
validation: Verify exact pixel dimensions match required sizes
Confirm screenshots show app in use

step_5_optional_annotations.task: Add text overlays or design elements (optional)
annotation_ideas: Device frames (show screenshot inside iPhone/iPad mockup)
step_5_optional_annotations.caution: Simple screenshots often perform better than over-designed ones

landscape_orientation.when_to_use: If app primarily used in landscape (e.g., games, video apps)
landscape_orientation.note: All screenshots in a set must use same orientation (portrait or landscape)

localization.description: Provide localized screenshots for each supported language
localization.requirement: Optional but recommended for international markets
workflow: Change app language in Xcode scheme or device settings
Capture new screenshots for localized UI
Upload separate screenshot sets for each locale in App Store Connect
localization.benefit: Significantly improves conversion in localized markets

app_previews.description: Optional 30-second video previews (autoplay on product page)

specifications.resolution: Same as screenshot sizes (e.g., 1290x2796 for 6.7" iPhone)

content_guidelines: Can add text overlays and narration
NO static images or animations only

creation_tools.screen_recording: iOS Screen Recording (Settings → Control Center → Screen Recording)
creation_tools.export_settings: 1080p or higher, H.264 codec, AAC audio

app_previews.note: App previews optional but increase engagement by 25% on average

only_splash_screen.problem: All screenshots are splash screen or app icon
only_splash_screen.symptom: Rejection for not showing app in use
only_splash_screen.fix: Capture actual app features and functionality

wrong_dimensions.problem: Screenshots not exact pixel size (e.g., 1280x2796 instead of 1290x2796)
wrong_dimensions.fix: Use correct simulator size, verify dimensions before upload

test_data_visible.fix: Use realistic data for all screenshots

mature_content.problem: Screenshots contain violent/sexual content despite 4+ rating
mature_content.fix: Ensure ALL metadata (screenshots, icons) are 4+ safe

inconsistent_orientation.problem: Mix of portrait and landscape in same screenshot set
inconsistent_orientation.fix: Use consistent orientation for all screenshots in a set

testing_checklist.method: Check image properties (width x height) match required sizes exactly
Ensure screenshots match current app version functionality
Confirm no mature content if app rated 4+
First 3 screenshots most compelling (shown in search)
If localized, verify language accuracy and UI correctness
View how screenshots look on actual App Store (use TestFlight preview)

step_1_identify_screens.ai_task: Analyze app structure to identify key screens

step_3_navigate_and_capture.ai_task: Automate UI navigation and screenshot capture
step_3_navigate_and_capture.config: Snapshotfile defines which screens to capture

fastlane_snapshot_example.benefit: Automates screenshot capture for multiple devices and languages

capture_screenshots.description: Automate screenshot capture for all required devices
capture_screenshots.validation: Verify screenshots/ directory contains all required sizes

validate_dimensions.description: Check if screenshots match required pixel dimensions
